location: 440 Saint Katherine Dr., La Cañada Flintridge, CA 91011.
description: One panel is of seven Plains Indian men on horseback. The other is a procession of diversly attired people walking along a figurative timeline from an old California mission toward the Los Angeles City Hall (just completed in 1928, the previous year). This property was originally built as a hotel. However, the 1929 stock market crash led to its demise after only two years in operation. Two years later Dominican nuns bought it and turned it into a Catholic girls' high school. 2 panels. Sponsored and Commissioned by Flintridge Biltmore Hotel. Photo © Robin Dunitz.
